## Overview

This session is devoted to learning R. There are no required readings. 

  
## Slides

Torven's slides will be on Nuku/Canvas.



## OPTIONAL extra material

(1) A very accessible resource on learning R is Megan Hall's lecture here: 
[https://meghan.rbind.io/talk/neair/](https://meghan.rbind.io/talk/neair/)

(2) R-studio has assembled many accessible materials for learning R here:

[https://education.rstudio.com/learn/beginner/](https://education.rstudio.com/learn/beginner/)

(3)  There is materia from a previous course on learning R can be found here.  At this stage, only lecture 1 would be relevant. Note that this lecture covers working with GitHub. Github is useful, however, there is no requirement for you to work with GitHub in the present course. 

[https://go-bayes.github.io/psych-447/](https://go-bayes.github.io/psych-447/)
